knimeNode.name: Predictor
knimeNode.shortDescription: Predict bacterial concentrations based on fitted primary or primary and secondary models

fullDescription.intro: Having fitted primary models to laboratory data and secondary models to the change of parameter values (e.g. the change of Âµmax due to different temperatures) enables you to predict bacterial growth / survival / inactivation. In order to obtain a realistic prediction on microbial kinetics this node should ony be used for the same test conditions measured in the original tests.
fullDescription.option:
Define the starting value of the 'Initial Concentration Parameter'.
Example: If 'log10N0' is the 'Initial Concentration Parameter' and if the 'Initial Concentration' equals 3.5, the microbial concentration will be predicted according to the estimated model and will start with a concentration of log 3.5 cfu/g.
Choose a parameter of the formula to be predicted

ports.inPort: Needs estimated models and data (time steps) from the PMM Joiner
ports.outPort: Predicted microbial concentrations, which can be viewed with the nodes "Model View Primary" or "Model Selection Primary"
